greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lowest canonical Gray cycles of length 2n.
comment: See A236602 for definitions regarding canonical Gray sequences (CGC). The CGC's of a given length can be sorted 'lexically'; for example, the CGC {0 1 5 4 6 7 3 2} precedes {0 1 5 7 3 2 6 4}. This sequence is then the flattened triangular table of the terms of the lowest CGC for each even length L, where L = 2*<row index>.
Note: zero unequivocally marks the start of each CGC.
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..306
Sykora S., On Canonical Gray Cycles, Stan's Library, Vol.V, January 2014, DOI: 10.3247/SL5Math14.001.
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Feb 01 2014
